text: [Music]
oh it's massive I mean it's massive in
lots of really tedious and boring ways
you know uh a lot of ways that are
easily overlooked uh you know inside a
lot of really large organizations one of
the problems they have is um sort of
pointless duplication of effort so I I
just recently I met somebody at IBM who
was just relating an anecdote that he
had been working on a certain kind of
project for um I don't know a year or
something and by pure random chance he
stumbled across someone who's been doing
exactly the same thing for a year and
IBM's a huge huge organization it's not
surprising that kind of stuff happens
but it would have been really helpful if
these two had met each other uh you know
a year ago because they could have split
up the work and gotten it done twice as
fast or they could have at least learned
from each other or one of them could
have said hey you you take it I got
something else I need to do um and
actually they met each other through a
Wiki so that was pretty good right they
they actually through an internal Wiki
they were able to uh coordinate their
efforts a lot better uh I think those
are uh the kinds of things that don't
make headlines you know just the idea
that through Information Technology
within an organization there's a a lot
more transparency and visibility as to
who's doing what uh and that has huge
business benefits I mean huge social
benefits right I mean certainly in in
the grand scheme of things in the whole
world we've got a lot of problems that
we need to solve right we need to do a
lot of different things and it's just
terrible if two people are wasting time
doing the same thing as each other right
it just makes no sense to anybody uh the
other person could be doing something
else that's useful so I think it's it's
of massive
importance
